Key Match Events: Sri Lanka were 140 for 1 in a chase of 214 but then lost nine wickets for 30 runs
Suryakumar Yadav hit a half-century in his first match as India's permanent T20I captain
Pathum Nissanka's free-stroking 79 left an Indian team playing with just five bowling options hanging onto crumbs of hope
India converted that opening into a double-strike when Kusal Perera fell four balls later
Post-Match Reflections: India's new T20I era under Suryakumar Yadav began on a winning note
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shubman Gill had acknowledged the need to improve his T20I batting template. On Saturday, he walked the talk
Others: Sri Lanka's counter-punch forced mistakes from India
